abstracts.cdata!:
The Community Development Project will
            improve project-supported social, and economic services
            within poor rural communities. The components will: 1)
            finance small-scale subprojects generated by the
            communities, through the Fonds d'Intervention pour le
            Developpement (FID), in a participatory rural appraisal
            process. Except for roads, and complex irrigation systems
            executed by the FID, investments will be executed by
            community associations, whose capacity will be strengthened
            through training provision. Those communes, selected based
            on poverty indicators, will be improved through community
            mobilization, and consultation processes, to be able to
            identify specific investments, and contribute as well, a
            percentage of its costs, in materials, labor, and money.
            Financing of consulting services will be provided for
            technical aspects of the investment, and training will
            ensure the adequacy of the investment cycle; 2) support
            capacity building activities for local government officials,
            and personnel of commune governments. Training in community
            participation, mobilization, and in drafting communal
            development plans will be provided, in addition to
            accounting, fiscal budgeting, and procurement training; 3)
            transfer funds to communes for financing activities in their
            communal development plans, with full powers over project
            execution to commune governments; and, 4) finance the
            operation of the FID entity, which will be responsible for
            overseeing the implementation of activities financed by the project.
